str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Filth, pollution, defilement. From rhuparos; dirtiness.
Abundance, superfluity. From perisseuo; surplusage, i.e. Superabundance.
From kakos; badness, i.e. depravity, or malignity, or trouble.
Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Inborn, ingrown, congenital, natural, rooted, implanted. From en and a derivative of phuo; implanted.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
